page.title: 10Tates Coaches.Markyate
page.content: {TATES COACHES Markyate has its own firm of coach operators. They are called Tates Coaches and were started in 1947 by William Tate. He decided he had enough money to buy an old coach instead of driving a lorry.He started off at the side of the filling station which is now Jacobs Biscuit Warehouse. Then, when the old gasworks closed down, they managed to get half of it and shared it with Mr.Burgess who owned some lorries.In 1979 they needed a bigger garage and more room for their coaches, so they bought B&B Coach Services at Potten End.On average eight coaches are used every day.They employ eight full-time drivers and several part-timers who work mainly at weekends. Altogether they have got nine coaches and two buses.
